text:
September 21, 1956
Mr, James A. Byrd
Business Manager
Central State College
Wilberforce, Ohio
Dear Jfr. Byrd*
In response to your recent request, we would like to give you information
regarding membership in the National Association of Educational Broadcasters.
The NAEB has three categories of membership, as follows*
Active — -ducational institutions, public service organizations, etc.
owning and operating their own radio and/or television stations.
Associate - Institutions (as above) not owning stations, but operating
production centers and regularly producing programs over a
commercial outlet.
Affiliate - Any organization or individual interested in the general
furtherance of educational broadcasting.
For Active members with radio stations, dues in the association are based on
rated transmitter power, as follows*
Class A - 5 kw and over - $50.00
Class B •• 1 •» 4.9 kw - 25.00
Class C - less than 1 kl*/ - 15.00
Television stations with less than 5 kw video power pay $50.00 and those with
5 kw or more video power pay $100.00.
Associate and Affiliate members pay $10.00 a year. For this fee members receive
our monthly Newsletter; the various reports and surveys we publish periodically;
services of our Placement Service, television engineer, legal counsel, management
consultant, etc.; plus the normal day to day services, information, and advice that
any national organization gives Its members. Under separate cover we are sending
you samples of some of the materials we regularly send our members, plus other
items which will give you more information about the Association. Of course.
Associate and Affiliate members do not receive as many of these materials as
regularly as Active members do*
